author: Joe Noga, cleveland.com
title: Guardians punch ticket to MLB playoffs, outlast Twins for 3-2 win in extra innings - cleveland.com
text:
23
1 / 23 Guardians celebrate as they clinch playoff berth By Joe Noga, cleveland.com CLEVELAND, Ohio — A season of unexpected success will continue into October for the Cleveland Guardians, who clinched a Major League Baseball playoff spot with a 3-2 win in 10 innings Thursday against the Twins at Progressive Field.
Andrés Giménez drilled an RBI single into right field off Twins lefty Caleb Thielbar to score automatic runner José Ramírez for Cleveland’s second straight walk-off victory and seventh of the season.
The Guardians (89-65) are 10-3 in extra-inning games and notched their 42nd comeback win while improving the best home record in the AL to 48-28.
Giménez’s base hit touched off a wild celebration between first and second base. It was the fourth career walk-off plate appearance for Giménez and his second this season.
“I mean, that’s us, that’s the Cleveland Guardians this whole year,” Giménez said. ”We never give up. The guys in the bullpen really give us a chance to stay in the game, and from there we just have to do our job and try to keep the line moving.”
More Guardians coverage Guardians playoff gear: How to get shirts, hats Josh Naylor answers to higher calling when it comes to homers: Guardians takeaways Cleveland Guardians, Minnesota Twins starting lineups for Sept. 19, 2024: Game 154 Related — Guardians playoff gear: How to get shirts, hats for Cleveland’s run through October
The Guardians were not a popular pick to reach the playoffs when the season started, but have spent the last 23 weeks perched atop the American League Central Division, yielding sole possession of the division’s top spot for only one day, when they shared the position with Kansas City last month.
Behind first-year manager Stephen Vogt, Cleveland became the second team in the AL to claim a spot in the playoffs after the Yankees, who punched their ticket late Wednesday in Seattle. It marks the 17th playoff appearance in franchise history for the club with baseball’s longest World Series championship drought, a dry spell that dates back to 1948.
Vogt said until he saw Giménez’s line drive hit green grass, he had not allowed himself to get excited about reaching the postseason.
“We just started hugging,” Vogt said. “Alby (bench coach Craig Albernaz) and just what this group has been through. This is really special. The goal is to get in and then from here we keep pushing. Once you get in, you have a chance.”
Guardians rookie Joey Cantillo pitched into the fifth inning before turning things over to the top-ranked bullpen in baseball. Cleveland relievers tossed 5 2/3 scoreless innings, holding the Twins hitless and striking out eight.
Minnesota threatened to score in the top of the 10th as Eli Morgan loaded the bases by hitting Matt Wallner with a pitch and walking Manuel Margot. But Morgan retired Carlos Correa on a pop to first base in foul territory and escaped the inning when Byron Buxton sent a fly ball to Lane Thomas in right for the final out. Morgan (3-0, 1.64) earned his third win while Thielbar (3-4, 5.65) lost for just the second time in his last 14 appearances.
13
1 / 13 Guardians vs Minnesota Twins, September 19, 2024 Cantillo was brilliant through four innings, but ran into trouble in the fifth when Kyle Farmer led off with a double and Willi Castro walked to set up a two-run double by Margot. Cantillo worked ahead in the count, but left a changeup over the middle of the plate that Margot drilled to the gap in left center.
Thomas cut the ball off, but did not handle the bounce cleanly, allowing Castro to come all the way around and score for a 2-1 Twins lead. Nick Sandlin relieved Cantillo and walked Correa before striking out Buxton and Carlos Santana to end the inning.
Cleveland tied the score in the bottom of the sixth after loading the bases against Minnesota lefty Cole Irvin. Base hits by Josh Naylor, Giménez and Jhonkensy Noel set the stage for a Brayan Rocchio RBI sacrifice fly to center that knotted the score at two runs apiece.
Cantillo struck out six and walked three, allowing two runs (one earned) on three hits in his third start since rejoining the roster Sept. 9 when Alex Cobb went on the injured list with blisters on his right hand. Since his return, Cantillo has logged at least four scoreless innings in each outing, including six perfect frames against the White Sox and 21 strikeouts to go along with four walks in 16 innings.
Cantillo said Thursday’s effort showed heart.
“Everyone’s been saying all year, everybody on this team loves each other and plays for each other,” Cantillo said. “It doesn’t matter if you’re down three, down two or tied, this team is going to fight until the 27th out.”
Rookie designated hitter Kyle Manzardo, batting second in Vogt’s lineup for the first time this season, opened the scoring when he yanked a changeup from Twins starter Simeon Woods Richardson into the seats in right for his fourth home run and second of the series. Manzardo added a one-out single in the third and a check-swing infield hit in the fifth for his fourth multi-hit game in 16 September appearances.
Manzardo entered Thursday’s game batting .357 (15 for 42) with four home runs, seven RBI and a 1.104 OPS in 16 games since being recalled from Triple-A Columbus on Sept. 1.
Next : The Guardians head out on their final road trip of the regular season with three games in St. Louis beginning Friday at Busch Stadium. First pitch is set for 8:15 p.m. Right-hander Ben Lively (12-9, 3.87) will start for Cleveland, while righty Kyle Gibson (8-7, 4.11) takes the mound for the Cardinals. The game will air on Bally Sports Great Lakes , WTAM 1100 AM, WMMS 100.7 FM. and the Guardians Radio Network.

author: Cadena 3 Argentina
title: Tormenta en Córdoba con fuertes vientos: hubo destrozos en el sur provincial
text:

Turno Noche
Las zonas más afectadas fueron Río Cuarto, Coronel Moldes y Reducción, donde se reportaron daños materiales. En la capital, se registraron ráfagas de hasta 95 Km/h. Recomiendan no circular y tomar precauciones.
FOTO: La lluvia llegó a la capital cordobesa.
FOTO: Tormenta en Córdoba con fortísimas ráfagas de viento: hubo destrozos en el sur
FOTO: Villa María. Foto de Víctor Rocha
FOTO: Anuncian alerta por tormentas y granizo en Córdoba (Foto: archivo).
FOTO: Tormenta eléctrica en Sampacho
FOTO: Tormenta eléctrica en Sampacho
FOTO: Tormenta eléctrica en Sampacho
FOTO: Tormenta en Córdoba con fortísimas ráfagas de viento: hubo destrozos en el sur
La provincia de Córdoba enfrentó este jueves a la noche una intensa tormenta, que causó importantes destrozos, especialmente en el sur, donde se registraron caídas de árboles y voladuras de chapas.
La situación llevó a la activación de todos los cuerpos de seguridad en la capital provincial, que se prepararon para asistir a la población afectada.
Roberto Schreiner, vocero de la Secretaría de Gestión de Riesgo de Córdoba, señaló a Cadena 3 que “toda la gente de Defensa Civil, Bomberos y Policía están preparadas para asistir a todo lo que pase en la ciudad de Córdoba”.
La tormenta ingresó a la capital provincial por la zona sur con vientos de hasta 95 kilómetros por hora y lluvias intensas, aunque el granizo cayó en diferentes lugares.
Las áreas más afectadas incluyen [Río Cuarto](https://www.cadena3.com/pagina/tag/?q=Río Cuarto), [Coronel Moldes](https://www.cadena3.com/pagina/tag/?q=Coronel Moldes) y [Reducción](https://www.cadena3.com/pagina/tag/?q=Reducción), donde se reportaron daños materiales significativos.
“Los vientos del Río Cuarto tiraron postes de luz y árboles”, detalló Roberto, quien también mencionó que no hay reportes de víctimas hasta el momento.
Las recomendaciones para la ciudadanía incluyen permanecer en casa, evitar sacar la basura para no obstruir desagües y tener cuidado al circular por las rutas. También se aconsejó no resguardarse cerca de árboles o postes de luz, ya que pueden caer durante la tormenta.
En cuanto al estado de las rutas, se reportó un corte entre [Yacanto](https://www.cadena3.com/pagina/tag/?q=Yacanto) y [Santa Rosa de Calamuchita](https://www.cadena3.com/pagina/tag/?q=Santa Rosa de Calamuchita) debido a caídas de árboles. “Los bomberos de Yacanto y Santa Rosa acudieron al lugar y están tratando de habilitar la ruta”, informó Schreiner. Además, la ruta 28 sigue cortada por desmoronamientos, lo que podría agravar la situación con las lluvias actuales.
En Coronel Moldes, la intensa tormenta de granizo y lluvia generó serios inconvenientes. El intendente, Ezequiel Moiso, brindó a Cadena 3 detalles sobre la situación actual, destacando que, a pesar de los problemas, no se registraron evacuaciones.
"Tenemos un panorama complicado, pero, gracias a Dios, solamente fue un susto grande", afirmó Moiso.
/Inicio Código Embebido/
— Leonardo Guevara (@leoguevara80)
[#Cordoba]se vino el tormenta que anunciaban[#Alrte]para toda la provincia ?? por ahora viento muy fuerte tierra y después lluvia.[pic.twitter.com/3mWUyRxD45][December 12, 2024]
/Fin Código Embebido/
El intendente explicó que se asistió a varias viviendas afectadas por el ingreso de agua, resultado del mal estado de los techos y los fuertes vientos. "No tengo a ciencia exacta la cantidad de milímetros que ha llovido, pero algunos hablan de 90 y otros, de 100 milímetros juntos", indicó.
Además, mencionó que la localidad está en la trayectoria del desagüe de Sampacho, lo que contribuyó a la acumulación de agua en los canales.
Moiso también se refirió a la gran cantidad de granizo que cayó en la zona, describiendo el tamaño de las piedras: "Pocas piedras de un tamaño de huevo de paloma, pero granizo a montones".
Este fenómeno meteorológico provocó daños en algunos techos, que ya estaban comprometidos por tormentas anteriores. "Esto terminó el trabajo que había iniciado en las otras tormentas", agregó.
El intendente confirmó que el mayor inconveniente se debió a la acumulación de granizo en las canaletas, que alcanzó los 50 centímetros de altura. "Colapsaron lo que en los techos de chapa se ganó y hubo sectores donde ingresó el agua", explicó Moiso, quien también destacó que sólo se registró agua en el piso.
Finalmente, Moiso informó que se recuperó la energía eléctrica en la localidad, aunque el panorama se mantiene incierto debido a la posible reactivación de la tormenta. "Si el sur o su oeste amenazante -se ve bastante oscuro- podría volver la lluvia en cualquier momento", concluyó.
Anunciaron alerta en Córdoba por tormenta con altas probabilidades de precipitaciones y granizo, según dijo a Cadena 3 el secretario de Seguridad y Prevención Comunitaria de la Municipalidad, Claudio Vignetta.
En ese sentido, advirtió que el fenómeno climático se extenderá hasta aproximadamente la 1 de la madrugada del viernes.
A su vez, señaló que en la ciudad habrá vientos intensos, precipitaciones y, en algunos casos, granizo.
/Inicio Código Embebido/
Mirá también
/Fin Código Embebido/
A pesar de que no se espera un gran volumen de lluvia, el funcionario advirtió que "habrá precipitaciones en corto periodo de tiempo", lo que podría causar inconvenientes en la vía pública, especialmente en las calles debido a las correntías del agua.
Por ello, recomendó a los ciudadanos "tratar de no circular y tener todas las precauciones". Y pidió prestar atención a las recomendaciones de los servicios de seguridad, incluyendo Defensa Civil de la Municipalidad y la Policía.
"Vamos a trabajar todos en equipo para tratar de que este evento no tenga ninguna consecuencia importante", concluyó.
/Inicio Código Embebido/
Mirá también
/Fin Código Embebido/
.

Lo último de Sociedad

Esperado evento

Alimento contaminado
Fue en la Facultad de Arquitectura. Se infectaron con la bacteria Salmonella. El hijo de un docente hospitalizado dijo a Cadena 3 que la causa habría sido una mayonesa en mal estado. Piden rescindir el contrato del bar.
Choque múltiple
Fue en la autopista Córdoba-Rosario, a la altura del kilómetro 636. Al parecer, uno de los rodados de gran porte impactó contra la herramienta utilizada para limpiar la banquina. Uno de los choferes fue trasladado a un hospital.

author: News service report
title: UFC pioneer hospitalized after saving parents from house fire
text: TOLEDO, Ohio — UFC Hall of Famer and former champion Mark Coleman called himself “the happiest man in the world” as he embraced members of his family from a hospital bed. Coleman was airlifted to a hospital on Wednesday after saving his parents from a house fire in Ohio this week, according to daughter Morgan Coleman. On Thursday, an emotional video was posted to Mark Coleman’s Instagram. “I swear to God, I’m so lucky,” Coleman said in the video. “I can’t believe my parents are alive. I had to make a decision. I got out of my room and went to the door and it was already horrible. I couldn’t breathe. I almost had to go outside, but I went back and got them. I can’t believe it.” Morgan Coleman had posted that her father went into the burning house several times and was able to bring out his mother and father. Coleman said at the time that her 59-year-old father was “battling for his life after this heroic act.” Hammer, the family dog, awakened Coleman to the blaze around 4 a.m. Tuesday, the family said on a GoFundMe page. Coleman pulled his father from the burning home, then his mother, before attempting to save the dog, who ultimately died. “I got them (his parents) but couldn’t find Hammer,” Coleman said in the Instagram video. Coleman, from Fremont, Ohio, was UFC’s first heavyweight champion in 1997 when he defeated Dan Severn. He won 16 of 26 fights over his 14-year career and was inducted into the UFC Hall of Fame in 2008. Before his MMA career, Coleman was a standout wrestler. He won a national championship at Ohio State and a silver medal at the 1991 world championships. He also earned a seventh-place finish at the 1992 Barcelona Summer Olympics. Morgan Coleman has organized a gofundme.com site for her father, raising more than $70,000 as of Thursday afternoon. Success. Please wait for the page to reload. author: João Castro
title: Liga Conferência: Podence brilha e Paulo Fonseca também garante os quartos | Abola.pt
text:
Noite de felicidade portuguesa no terceiro escalão do futebol europeu
Depois de Fenerbahçe , Fiorentina , PAOK e Viktoria Plzen , foram o Aston Villa , Club Brugge , Lille e Olympiakos a garantir o apuramento para os quartos de final da Liga Conferência , e com marca portuguesa.
14 março 2024, 19:54
Liga Conferência: PAOK dá a volta à eliminatória com goleada e avança para os ‘quartos’ Fenerbahçe e Fiorentina também estão na próxima fase. Viktoria Plzen elimina Servette nos penáltis e está nas melhores oito equipas
Daniel Podence brilhou na reviravolta épica do Olympiakos frente ao Maccabi Tel Aviv. Vitória expressiva por 6-1 depois da derrota por 4-1 na primeira-mão. O português marcou o primeiro golo e bisou em assistências com Chiquinho e David Carmo também a titulares.
Já o Lille, de Paulo Fonseca, não foi além do empate a um golo frente ao Sturm Graz, mas beneficiou da vitória por 4-1 na primeira-mão. Um jogo também com golo português: Tiago Santos fez o 1-0 do Lille e Mika Biereth empatou para os austríacos.
O Ajax foi atropelado na visita ao Aston Villa depois do empate a zero golos na primeira-mão. Watkins, Bailey, Jhon Duran e Moussa Diaby marcaram para os ingleses, sendo que a equipa de Amsterdão ficou reduzida aos 66 minutos com a expulsão de Mannsverk.
Por fim, o Club Brugge confirmou a passagem aos quartos frente ao Molde com uma vitória contundente por 3-0. Skov Olsen bisou e Skoras estabeleceu o resultado final.
Tags: Liga Conferência Lille Daniel Podence Olympiakos
